intro: Botryanthus strangwaysii, commonly known as the African snowball. It is a flowering plant native to South Africa, characterized by its dense, spherical clusters of white flowers. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family and is known for its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens. Its unique appearance and ease of cultivation have contributed to its popularity among horticulturists.
